greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists n terms, starting with 2n-1, with gaps = n-1 between successive terms.
comment: Note that the last term of the n-th row is the n-th square A000290(n).
Row sums are n*(n^2+2*n-1)/2, apparently in A127736. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 20 2009
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: print([A162610(n,k) for n in range(1,20) for k in range(1,n+1)])
a162610 n k = k * n - k + n
xref: Cf. A209297; A005408 (left edge), A000290 (right edge), A127736 (row sums), A056220 (central terms), A026741 (number of odd terms per row), A142150 (number of even terms per row), A221491 (number of primes per row).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 09 2009
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 20 2009
